description: Rob Scurlock says he was issued with a fine despite being told his father's service could overrun.
title: Son fined after dad's funeral overruns by 13 minutes
title_page: Taunton Crematorium: Son fined after dad's funeral overruns by 13 minutes - BBC News
maintext:
A grieving son says he feels "angry and frustrated" after being fined Â£432 because his father's funeral service overran by 13 minutes.
The family of the late William Scurlock, 79, were allotted 40 minutes for his funeral at Taunton Crematorium, Somerset, in September 2024.
His son Rob Scurlock said: "We followed their guidance and we were told we would have an extra ten discretionary minutes."
Somerset Council, which manages Taunton Crematorium, said funeral times have to be "strictly controlled but charges for overrunning are being reviewed".
Mr Scurlock said the family booked the last slot of the day to "avoid any issues for anyone coming in after us".
He said the extra 10 minutes he was told he could have were not noted when the fine was issued.
